fields.headline: The green gauge
fields.bodyText: Going up Beyond hugging Greenpeace's new Forest Love video urges viewers to 'show forests some love' Protecting privacy Australian designer Hamit Kanuni Kuralkan has come up with a blueprint to overcome the fear of sharing space on public transport: the train with pop-up capsules might just catch on The older the better Revised IPCC figures show pristine temperate forests are the best, storing 60 per cent more carbon than quick-grow plantations Going down Size matters Smaller primates, such as the mouse lemur, are in greater danger of extinction than the great apes, thanks to habitat loss and hunting Walking the streets A survey shows 72 per cent of UK workers feel seriously stressed daily. Most say symptoms can be minimised by a walk in the park. Shame green spaces are vanishing No dogs allowed Pet dogs are likely to be banned in new residential areas of Australia to protect the declining koala population
